title: The Group Chat Leak
description: A private photo is shared in a WhatsApp group. Learn how to stop the spread and stay safe.
intro_scene: You wake up to 50 missed notifications. A private photo you shared in confidence is now in the 'Class of 2024' WhatsApp group.

start.text: Your heart is pounding. You see the photo. It's definitely yours. What is your immediate reaction?

leave_group.text: You leave the group. You feel a bit safer not seeing the messages, but you lost the evidence of who posted it.
leave_group.feedback: Leaving protects your peace, but gathering evidence first is helpful for reporting.

screenshot.text: You take screenshots of the photo, the sender's number, and the group info. Now you have proof.
screenshot.feedback: Excellent. Evidence is crucial for reporting to platforms or authorities.

lesson_ncii.text: This situation is known as Non-Consensual Intimate Image (NCII) abuse.

lessonCard.title: Understanding NCII
lessonCard.what: In Kenya, sharing intimate images without consent is illegal under the Computer Misuse and Cybercrimes Act.

next_steps.text: The photo is still there. You need to get it removed.

choices.text: Ask the group admin to remove it
Threaten the sender in the group

ask_admin.text: The admin apologizes and deletes the message for everyone. It stops the immediate spread.
ask_admin.feedback: Admins have the power to remove content. It's a safe and quick first step.

threaten.text: You send an angry message. The sender mocks you, and others join in. The situation escalates.
threaten.feedback: Anger is valid, but engaging with trolls often makes it worse. Block and report instead.

end_success.text: You managed to contain the situation and kept evidence. You are safe for now.

end_rough.text: The situation was stressful, but you learned what not to do next time. You are safe now.

title: The Bystander
description: You see someone being bullied online. Decide how to help without putting yourself at risk.
intro_scene: You are scrolling through Instagram and see a classmate, Amina, being flooded with hateful comments on her new post.

start.text: Comments say 'You're ugly', 'Delete this', and worse. Amina hasn't replied yet. What do you do?

choices.text: Reply to the bullies defending her
DM Amina to check on her

reply_bullies.text: You comment back. The bullies turn their attention to you. Now you are both being targeted.
reply_bullies.feedback: Direct confrontation can backfire. It feeds the trolls.

dm_amina.text: You send a DM: 'Hey, I saw the comments. Are you okay? I'm here for you.'
dm_amina.feedback: Perfect. Private support means the world to survivors and keeps you safe.

lesson_ally.text: Being an ally means supporting the survivor, not just fighting the abuser.

lessonCard.title: Safe Allyship
lessonCard.what: Cyberbullying affects mental health deeply. Allies can interrupt the harm.
fix: Encourage them to take a break

end.text: You played your part in making the internet safer.

title: The 'Modeling' Offer
description: A stranger offers you a modeling gig but asks for 'body shots' first. Spot the red flags of sextortion.
intro_scene: You get a DM from 'TalentScout_254'. They say you have 'the look' and want to sign you for a campaign.

start.text: They send a link to a professional-looking website. Then they ask: 'Can you send some bikini photos so we can see your measurements?'

choices.text: Send the photos (it's a big opportunity)
Ask for a video call or office meeting first

send_photos.text: You send the photos. Immediately, the tone changes. 'Pay me 5000 KES or I post these on your school page.'
send_photos.feedback: This is sextortion. Never pay. They will just ask for more.

verify.text: You ask to meet. They make excuses: 'I'm traveling', 'Just trust me'. They get aggressive.
verify.feedback: Legitimate agencies don't hide. Aggression is a major red flag.

lesson_sextortion.text: Sextortion relies on fear and shame. You are not alone.

lessonCard.title: Dealing with Sextortion
lessonCard.what: Sextortion is when someone threatens to share your intimate images unless you pay or do what they say.
prevent: Never share intimate images with strangers
fix: Stop contact (don't block yet, keep evidence)

end.text: You stayed calm and protected yourself. Remember, your safety comes first.

title: Urgent Account Alert
description: You receive an urgent email claiming your social media account will be deleted. Don't take the bait.
intro_scene: An email pops up: 'SECURITY ALERT: Your Instagram will be suspended in 24 hours. Click here to verify.'

start.text: The email looks real. It has the logo. The link says 'instagram-verify-security.com'. What do you do?

choices.text: Click the link to save your account

click_link.text: The site asks for your password. You enter it. Suddenly, you are logged out of your real app.
click_link.feedback: Phishing sites often look identical to real ones. Always check the URL.

check_sender.text: You tap the sender name. It says 'support@gmail.com', not '@instagram.com'. It's a fake.
check_sender.feedback: Great spotting! Official companies send emails from their own domains.

lesson_phishing.text: Phishing attacks try to steal your login info by creating a sense of urgency.

lessonCard.title: Spotting Phishing
lessonCard.what: Scammers use fear (urgency) to make you act without thinking.

end.text: You kept your account safe. Always pause before you click.

title: The Fake Video Threat
description: A deepfake video of you goes viral on social media. Learn how to handle AI-generated abuse.
intro_scene: You receive a message from an ex: 'Watch this video I made of you. Share it or I'll post it everywhere.'

start.text: The video shows you saying embarrassing things you never said. It's convincing. What do you do?

choices.text: Report the video to the platform

ignore.text: You block them. But the video might still be out there if they shared it.
ignore.feedback: Blocking helps, but reporting ensures removal.

report.text: You report the message and video. The platform takes it down.

lesson_deepfake.text: Deepfakes are AI-generated fake videos or images that can harm your reputation.

lessonCard.title: Combating Deepfakes
lessonCard.what: In Kenya, creating or sharing non-consensual deepfakes is illegal under the Computer Misuse and Cybercrimes Act.
prevent: Be careful with sharing personal videos/photos
Use privacy settings on social media

end.text: You handled the threat wisely. Stay vigilant against emerging tech abuses.

title: Exposed Online
description: Your personal information is leaked, leading to harassment. Understand doxxing risks.
intro_scene: You find your home address, phone number, and photos posted on a forum with threats to visit you.

start.text: The post is gaining attention. Strangers are commenting. What is your first step?

choices.text: Report the post and gather evidence

delete_accounts.text: You delete your accounts. It stops the immediate harassment but you lose your online presence.
delete_accounts.feedback: Sometimes necessary, but reporting can remove the content.

report_post.text: You report the post. The forum removes it and bans the user.

lesson_doxxing.text: Doxxing is when someone reveals your personal information to cause harm or fear.

lessonCard.title: Protecting Against Doxxing
lessonCard.what: In Nigeria, doxxing can violate the Cybercrimes (Prohibition, Prevention, etc.) Act 2015.

end.text: You contained the leak. Remember to be cautious with your data.

title: The Online Mob
description: You see a friend being attacked online. Choose how to intervene safely.
intro_scene: On Facebook, your friend is being called racist slurs in a group post.

start.text: The comments are piling up. Your friend is upset. How do you help?

choices.text: Message your friend privately for support

public_defend.text: You comment back. The mob turns on you too. It escalates.
public_defend.feedback: Public confrontation can draw more hate.

private_support.text: You DM: 'I'm here for you. Block them and report.'
private_support.feedback: Private allyship is safer and more effective.

lesson_ally_sa.text: As an ally, your role is to support without becoming a target.

lessonCard.title: Safe Intervention
lessonCard.what: Cyberbullying can lead to real harm. In South Africa, it's addressed by the Cybercrimes Act.

end.text: You made a positive impact without risking yourself.

title: The 'Film' Opportunity
description: A fake producer asks for compromising photos. Spot the sextortion scam.
intro_scene: DM from 'FilmProducerGH': 'You have star potential. Send photos for casting.'

start.text: They ask for 'intimate shots' to 'see your range'. What do you do?

choices.text: Send the photos for the role

send_photos.text: You send them. They demand money: 'Pay 2000 GHS or I share.'
send_photos.feedback: This is classic sextortion. Never pay.

verify.text: You ask for proof. They get angry and block you.
verify.feedback: Legit opportunities don't pressure or hide.

lesson_sextortion_gh.text: Sextortion uses blackmail to exploit. You're not at fault.

lessonCard.title: Escaping Sextortion
lessonCard.what: In Ghana, sextortion violates the Electronic Communications Act.
prevent: Don't share intimate images with strangers

end.text: You avoided the trap. Stay aware of online scams.
